io.github.goodees.ese.core

Interface EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle<E extends EventSourcedEntity>

  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    Enclosing class:
    EntityInvocationHandler<E extends EventSourcedEntity>

    public static interface EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle<E extends EventSourcedEntity>
    Configuration aspect describing lifecycle of entity instances.

    Entity lifecycle

    1. If the EntityInvocationHandler.WorkingMemory contains an instance in its cache, it will be used
    2. Otherwise it will call instantiate(String) to create uninitialized instance
    3. If snapshot exists in SnapshotStore, it will be offered to an entity by invoking its method EventSourcedEntity.restoreFromSnapshot(Object)
    4. If entity accepts the snapshot, all events from the history past the snapshot will be passed, in order they were created, into method EventSourcedEntity.updateState(Event). If entity did not accept the snapshots, all events for the entity will be replayed.
    5. EventSourcedEntity.initialize() is called to let entity initialize its internal processes.
    After these steps the entity is initialized and requests will be passed to it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose(E entity)
      Perform clean up before removing an entity instance.
      E instantiate(String id)
      Create a new uninitialized instance for given id.

    • Method Detail

      • instantiate

        E instantiate(String id)
        Create a new uninitialized instance for given id. Serves for creating the entity with correct identity (as required by EventSourcedEntity.EventSourcedEntity(String) and any other dependencies the entity might need to execute request, e. g. references to stateless ejbs, singletons, or the dispatcher. Invocation handler will restore the state from snapshot and journal afterwards.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the entity
        Returns:
        instantiated entity

      • dispose

        void dispose(E entity)
        Perform clean up before removing an entity instance. This instance will no longer be used by the runtime, and if there are any steps to release its resources, they should be performed here. The method will be called by the processes within this package, it should not be invoked by runtime implementations itself.
        Parameters:
        entity - entity to dispose

      • shouldStoreSnapshot

        boolean shouldStoreSnapshot(E entity,
                            int eventsSinceSnapshot)
        Decide if snapshot should be stored for given instance. The decision, and snapshot is done after request has been invoked.
        Parameters:
        entity - instance to snapshot
        eventsSinceSnapshot - events applied since last snapshot
        Returns:
        true if storage of snapshot should be attempted.
